sen.j: 池坊専応（いけのぼうせんおう、文明 (日本)14年（1482年） - 天文 (元号)12年（1543年））は、戦国時代 (日本)の京都頂法寺（六角堂）の僧・立花師。
sen.e: Seno IKENOBO (1482 - 1543) was a Buddhist monk of Kyoto Choho-ji Temple (Rokkakudo) as well as a tatebana master who was active in the Sengoku Period (Japan).

Seno IKENOBO (1482 - 1543) was a Buddhist monk of Kyoto Choho-ji Temple (Rokkakudo) as well as a tatebana (flower arrangement) master in the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States).

sen.j: 天文年間（1532年-1555年）頃、立花の流派池坊を造形芸術にまで高めて、立花の体系化をはかり、池坊が立花界の主流となるきっかけを作った。
sen.e: During 1532-1555, he enhanced Ikenobo school of tatebana to the level of art, systemized tatebana and laid the foundation of Ikenobo school which later became the mainstream of Tatebana world.

sen.j: 晩年の口伝書「池坊専応口伝」は代々継承され、池坊華道の基本となるものとして「大巻」の名で呼ばれ、現在でも門弟に授けられている。
sen.e: "Senno Kuden", his oral tradition in his later yeas, has been inherited for generations, has been called "Omaki" as the basis of Ikenobo Ikebana and even at present, it is granted to pupils.
